info.title: NBCU TVE API
info.description:
The first version of the TVE API is an exciting step forward towards
making it easier for developers to access uniform TVE data. We created it
so that you can surface NBCU's amazing content in predictable, but fun and
innovative ways.

Build something great!

All endpoints are only accessible via https and are located at
uat-api.nbcuni.com.

For instance: you can grab the most popular videos at the moment by 
accessing the following URL with your api_key header:

```
  https://uat-api.nbcuni.com/videos/popular
```

## Deleting Objects
We do our best to have all our URLs be
[RESTful](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer).
Every endpoint (URL) may support one of four different http verbs. GET
requests fetch information about an object, POST requests create objects,
PUT requests update objects, and finally DELETE requests will delete
objects.
Since many old browsers don't support PUT or DELETE, we've made it easy to
fake PUTs and DELETEs. All you have to do is do a POST with _method=PUT or
_method=DELETE as a parameter and we will treat it as if you used PUT or
DELETE respectively.
## Structure
### The Envelope
Every response is contained by an envelope. That is, each response has a
predictable set of keys with which you can expect to interact:
```json
{
    "meta": {
        "code": 200
    },
    "data": {
        ...
    },
    "pagination": {
        "next_url": "...",
        "next_max_id": "13872296"
    }
}
```
#### META
The meta key is used to communicate extra information about the response to
the developer. If all goes well, you'll only ever see a code key with value
200.

However, sometimes things go wrong, and in that case you might see a
response like:
```json
{
    "meta": {
        "error_type": "Not Found Exception",
        "code": 404,
        "error_message": "..."
    }
}
```
#### DATA
The data key is the meat of the response. It may be a list or dictionary,
but either way this is where you'll find the data you requested.
#### PAGINATION
Sometimes you just can't get enough. For this reason, we've provided a
convenient way to access more data in any request for sequential data.
Simply call the url in the next_url parameter and we'll respond with the
next set of data.
```json
  {
      ...
      "pagination": {
          "next_url": "https://tve-api.nbcuni.com/content-api/pages/programs?max_id=13872296",
          "next_max_id": "13872296"
      }
  }
```
On views where pagination is present, we also support the "count" parameter.
Simply set this to the number of items you'd like to receive. Note that the
default values should be fine for most applications - but if you decide to
increase this number there is a maximum value defined on each endpoint.

### JSONP
If you're writing an AJAX application, and you'd like to wrap our response
with a callback, all you have to do is specify a callback parameter with
any API call:
```
https://uat-api.nbcuni.com/videos/recent?&callback=callbackFunction
```
Would respond with:
```js
callbackFunction({
    ...
});
```

app-id.name: app-id
app-id.description: The application (e.g. nbcd-roku, syfy-ios, etv-xbox) identifier

get.description: Paginated list of Lists, optionally limited by brand.

parameters.name: max_age
parameters.description: Return lists younger than this max_age

parameters.name: min_age
parameters.description: Return lists older than this min_age

post.description: POST (create) a new list of videos or programs.

get.description: 1 paginated list of content items, optionally limited by brand.
GET Paginated list of programs across all brands or 1 brand.

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Return programs earlier than this max_id.s

parameters.name: min_id
parameters.description: Return programs later than this min_id.

post.description: POST on or more programs to the Content Warehouse.

parameters.name: programs
parameters.description: Add/update programs in the content warehouse.

get.description: GET Paginated list of programs across all brands or 1 brand.

parameters.name: program-id
parameters.description: ID of specific program to return.

get.description: Paginated list of videos content across all brands or 1 brand.

parameters.name: max_id
parameters.description: Return videos earlier than this max_id.s

parameters.name: min_id
parameters.description: Return videosz later than this min_id.

post.description: POST one or more videos to the Content Warehouse.

get.description: Unbranded video data for the specified video.

parameters.name: max_date
parameters.description: Return videos earlier than this max_date

parameters.name: min_date
parameters.description: Return vidoes later than this min_date.

get.description: GET a list of supported App configurations.

post.description: Create a new app by POSTing its configuration data and optional MVPD.

get.description: Get configuration 'App' object for the specified app.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to add/update in the store

post.description: Add a Page (structure) with global metadata, layout, and styling markup for an app-specific view [with optional mvpd].  If the page contains an alias (e.g. home or watchlist, create/override the aliased page)

200.description: The new page object OR "The page was upodated"

get.description: Get a the view Page with "home" alias.
Get an App-specific structure-wrapped list of programs for an app.

parameters.name: mvpd-id
parameters.description: MVPD by which to filter programs.

get.description: Get program structure and content for a program, optionally including mvpd.
Get a video for an app, optionally altered by MVPD.

parameters.name: video-ids
parameters.description: array of IDs of recent unfinished videos

parameters.name: suggested-video-ids
parameters.description: array of IDs of ID of suggested videos

get.description: Get user-custom watchlist for an app. The first is the user's most recently incompletely watched video.  The second is the video with the 'suggestion' ID

404.description: One or more video not found

get.description: Returns the initial App-specific search UI WITH results if query parameter q is specified
App-specific play structure wrapping the specified video .

200.description: UI or App-wrapped heterogenous list of results
